Problem 4.2

Using Shadows and Mirrors to Find Heights

In the last problem, we found two ways to find missing lengths in pairs of similar figures.

Scale Factor Method

Use the scale factor to find the missing lengths between two similar figures.

OR

Ratios of Side Lengths Within Figures Method

Use the ratios of adjacent side lengths within each figure. The ratios are equal.

In Problem 3.3, we found the distance across a river using similar triangles. We can find the height of a school building by climbing a ladder and using a long tape measure. We can also use easier and less dangerous ways to find the height. In the next problem we will find the height of an object using similar triangles.
